description: {"blocks":[{"key":"23b3d","text":"Understanding the spatial organization of genomes within chromatin is crucial for deciphering gene regulation. In this protocol we describe application of an ALFA-tagged dCas9 protein in combination with a \nA. thaliana centromere-specific gRNA and a fluorescence-labeled NbALFA nanobody to label centromere-specific sequences in fixed Arabidopsis thaliana nuclei. The dCas9 protein possessing multiple copies of the ALFA-tag, in combination with a minibody and fluorescence-labelled anti-rabbit secondary antibody, resulted in enhanced target-specific signals. Furthermore, we describe the combination of the highly sensitive Tyramide Signal Amplification (TSA) method with CRISPR-FISH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":207,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":335,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: CRISPR-FISH, chromosomes, live cell imaging, dCas9, ALFA-tag, tyramide system

","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp9cb","text":"(b)  Transformation and Cultivation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pg7v","text":"Transform plasmids into Escherichia coli Rosetta 2(DE3) using heat shock transformation and plate on LB agar supplemented with 100 mg/L ampicillin and 30 mg/L chloramphenicol.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":24,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i287","text":"Select single colonies and inoculate them into liquid LB medium. Incubate overnight at 37 °C with shaking at 200 rpm.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vgpe","text":"Dilute the overnight cultures 1:50 into fresh 2x TY medium and grow at 37 °C until reaching an OD600 of 0.5.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eesk0","text":"Shift the cultures to 18 °C and incubate for 1 hour with shaking at 180 rpm.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ei67","text":"Induce protein expression by adding IPTG to a final concentration of 0.5 mM. Grow the cells at 18 °C with shaking at 180 rpm for 16 hours.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"didti","text":"Harvest the cells by centrifugation at 6500 rpm for 20 minutes at 4 °C. Store the resulting pellet at -80 °C or use immediately for protein purification.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mu45","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bnfd","text":"(c)   Purification of Recombinant Protein:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9koik","text":"Thaw the cell pellet on ice for 20 minutes and resuspend in lysis buffer containing 1 mg/mL lysozyme and an EDTA-free Protease Inhibitor Cocktail tablet.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6s7k","text":"Transfer the suspension to a new 50 mL Falcon tube and lyse for 30 minutes on ice, stirring every 5 minutes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mmck","text":"Flash-freeze the cells in liquid nitrogen and immediately thaw in water at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjkso","text":"Sonicate on ice for four cycles of 30 seconds each at 50% intensity.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buueg","text":"Incubate the lysate on ice after adding Benzonase to a final concentration of 1 μL/mL for 30 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8sb4","text":"Centrifuge the lysate at 7000 rpm for 20 minutes at 4 °C. Transfer the supernatant to a new 50 mL Falcon tube containing 1 mL of PureCube 100 Ni-NTA Agarose. Rotate at 4 °C for 90 minutes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"731fr","text":"Purify His-tagged proteins by gravity flow chromatography using disposable polypropylene columns. Discard the flow-through (see Note 2).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s0cr","text":"Wash the column twice with wash buffer and elute the protein with elution buffer in 10 x 1 mL fractions collected in 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes (see Note 3). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5utp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hg1f","text":"(d)   Protein Analysis and Storage:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvtgk","text":"Run the purified fractions on an SDS-PAGE gel and pool the fractions with higher protein concentration (see Note 3).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"m0jf","text":"Determine the concentration of the purified proteins using the Bradford assay and store the proteins at -20 °C for further use.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qbq5","text":"CRISPR-FISH employs the two-part guide RNA
(crRNA and trans-activating crRNA (tracrRNA)) system to produce functional
guide RNA. This system is commercially prepared by Integrated DNA Technologies
(IDT, USA) (see Note 4). The preparation of the ribonucleoprotein involves two
steps: (a) sgRNA formation and (b) RNP complex assembly (Fig. 1).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50o92","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daadh","text":"(a)   sgRNA Formation:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e5f3","text":"Add 20 μL of nuclease-free duplex buffer to lyophilized crRNA (2 nmol) on ice to produce 100 μM crRNA.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3eea1","text":"Add 50 μL of nuclease-free duplex buffer to lyophilized tracrRNA-ATTO550/biotin (5 nmol) on ice to produce 100 μM tracrRNA. Store the dissolved crRNA and tracrRNA separately at -20 °C.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dk43","text":"To assemble 10 μM sgRNA, add 8 μL of nuclease-free duplex buffer, 1 μL of 100 μM crRNA, and 1 μL of 100 μM tracrRNA-ATTO550/ATTO488 in a 0.2 mL PCR tube on ice.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hagh","text":"Incubate the sgRNA mix for 5 minutes at 95 °C using a Thermocycler. Turn off the machine and keep the PCR tube inside for about 10 minutes to cool down.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1og0t","text":"Store the labeled sgRNA at -20 °C (see Note 5).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo2ul","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqcnn","text":"(b)   RNP Complex Assembly:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6aoi9","text":"Add 80 μL of double-distilled water, 10 μL of 10x Cas9 buffer, and 10 μL of 10 mM DTT in a 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube. Mix by vortexing.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a79rv","text":"Add 1 μL of 10 μM sgRNA and 1 μL of 6.25 μM dCas9-ALFA-tag protein. Mix by vortexing.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gs1k","text":"Incubate the RNP complex at 26 °C for 10 minutes. Keep at 4 °C until use. Note that 100 μL
of RNP complex is sufficient for 3-4 slides.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ubi4","text":"Fix 10 mg of young Arabidopsis thaliana leaf tissue in 10 mL ice-cold 4% formaldehyde in Tris buffer for 5 minutes under vacuum using a speedy vac or similar device.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":19,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gt54","text":"Continue fixation for an additional 25 minutes in ice-cold fixative without vacuum.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r660","text":"Rinse the tissue twice for 5 minutes each in ice-cold Tris buffer.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arr6u","text":"Chop the tissue in 400–500 μL ice-cold LB01 buffer in a pre-cooled plastic Petri dish using a new razor blade.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pfim","text":"Filter the suspension through a mesh with a 30 or 50 μm pore size.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ohs7","text":"Dilute the extracted nuclei with LB01 buffer in a 1:10 ratio.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cur51","text":"Use a cytospin to spin 100 μL of the diluted nuclei extraction per slide at 700 rpm for 5 minutes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vr6p","text":"Transfer the slides into a Coplin jar and keep them in 1x PBS on ice until use (see Note 6). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: CRISPR-FISH with ALFA tag system and NbALFA
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"5vbkg","text":"Transfer the slides into a Coplin jar containing 100 mL of 1x PBS at room temperature
and wash twice for 5 minutes each (see Note 7). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rp3e","text":"Remove the excess buffer by tilting the slide. Apply 100 μL of 1x Cas9 buffer with 1
mM DTT per slide and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature. Remove the
excess buffer by tilting the slide.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gpag","text":"Add 20–30 μL of the RNP complex per slide and cover with a piece of parafilm to
avoid drying. Transfer the slides into a moisture chamber and incubate at 37 °C
for 1 hour (see Note 8).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9127g","text":"Remove the parafilm by rinsing the slides in a Coplin jar with 1x PBS for 5 minutes on
ice.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evvt0","text":"For post-fixation, place the slides in a Coplin jar containing 4% formaldehyde in
1x PBS for 5 minutes on ice.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87cvp","text":"Remove the formaldehyde by rinsing the slides in a Coplin jar with 1x PBS for 5
minutes on ice.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nrpo","text":"Block the slides with 100 μL of 4% BSA in 1x PBS for 1 hour at room temperature (RT)
in a humid chamber.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"526l8","text":"Wash the slides with 1x PBS for 5 minutes at RT in the dark.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbh8e","text":"Add 50 μL of NbALFA conjugated with ATTO488 (diluted 1:500 in 2% BSA in 1x PBS) or
